edu.rpi.phil.legup
Class Legup

java.lang.Object
  edu.rpi.phil.legup.Legup
public class Legup
extends java.lang.Object

The Legup class is the main class for the Legup Application. It provides access to all the major data structures and functionality necessary.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Drew Housten

Legup Constructor

Method Detail

displayGui

public void displayGui()
Creates a new LegupGui object. If this is not called, the program will run only in console mode.

getConfig

public Config getConfig()
Returns the Config object so that the calling code can have access to any configuration information

Returns:
Configuration object

getPuzzleList

public java.util.Vector getPuzzleList()
Gets a list of available puzzles from the Config object.

Returns:
Vector of puzzle names which are Strings

getAvailableBoardsList

public java.util.Vector getAvailableBoardsList(java.lang.String puzzle)
Gets a list of all available boards for a particular puzzle.

Parameters:
puzzle - Name of the puzzle to narrow the search on
Returns:
Vector of puzzle names which are Strings

loadPuzzle

public void loadPuzzle(java.lang.String puzzle,
                       java.lang.String board)
Loads a puzzle and the initial and goal boards

Parameters:
puzzle - Name of the puzzle
board - Location of the board file

getCurrentBoardState

public BoardState getCurrentBoardState()
Gets the currently selected board

Returns:
The current board state

setCurrentBoardState

public void setCurrentBoardState(BoardState newCurrentBoardState)
Sets the currently selected board state

Parameters:
newCurrentBoardState - New Board State to set as the current selected.

getInitialBoardState

public BoardState getInitialBoardState()
Gets the initial board state. This is the start step of the proof.

Returns:
Initial Board State

getBoardStates

public java.util.Vector getBoardStates()
Gets a Vector of all the Board States

Returns:
Vector of all the board states

getAppliedRules

public java.util.Vector getAppliedRules()
Gets a Vector of all the applied Rules. Applied Rules are the edges in the puzzle tree.

Returns:
Vector of all the applied rules

getPuzzleModule

public PuzzleModule getPuzzleModule()
Gets the active Puzzle Module. Each type of puzzle will have its own Puzzle Module which will provide support for puzzle-specific functionality

Returns:
The active Puzzle Module

addBoardState

public void addBoardState(BoardState newBoardState,
                          int branchNumber)
Adds a board state off of the current board state along the branch number specified. The new edge will have a default AppliedRule applied.

Parameters:
newBoardState - The new board state to add
branchNumber - The branchNumber to add the board state to

removeDanglingRules

public void removeDanglingRules()
Removes any applied rules that are no longer connecting states in the tree. This will automatically remove 'trash' that would accumulate when branches are removed

transitionState

public void transitionState()
Transitions the currently selected state. Any transitions from the current state will become new branches with new states and Applied Rules. The first branch found is used to update the currently selected state.

setRuleType

public void setRuleType(AppliedRule appliedRule,
                        PuzzleRule puzzleRule)
Applied a PuzzleRule to an AppliedRule. The AppliedRules are the edges in the tree while the PuzzleRules are static rules for each puzzle.

mergeStates

public void mergeStates(BoardState state1,
                        BoardState state2,
                        boolean replace)
Merges 2 states together. Any cell value that is the same in both BoardStates remains the same and any disagreeing cell value becomes a 0. If the replace flag is true, state1 will be replaced with the new BoardState. Transitions to and from will be updated accordingly.

Parameters:
state1 - 1st BoardState to merge
state2 - 2nd BoardState to merge
replace - Flag indicating if the 1st BoardState should be replaced with the new Board State

checkRule

public void checkRule(AppliedRule appliedRule)
Checks an AppliedRule to see if it is a valid application of the rule

Parameters:
appliedRule - AppliedRule to check

checkGoal

public boolean checkGoal()
Checks if the current board state matches the goal state.

Returns:
True if the states match, False otherwise

printStatus

public void printStatus()
Prints the status to the console

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Starts up the program and the gui
